Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: BEAst: Used by BEAst as the Order Receipt Response message. Peppol: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Peppol: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Response identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: T6406, Order receipt response ID. Peppol: A transaction instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the transaction instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Response issue date
Element.Description: BEAst: T6325, Document date time. Peppol: Document date time.

Element.Name: Response issue time
Element.Description: BEAst: T6325, Document date time. Peppol: Document date time.

Element.Name: Sender information
Element.Description: Peppol: The party sending an electronic message level response message back to the sending party of the business document.

Element.Name: Sender party electronic address
Element.Description: BEAst: T0008, Buyer. Peppol: Identifies the sender party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Receiver information
Element.Description: Peppol: The party, an electronic message level response was addressed to, and who is supposed to process the message level response. This is the same party as the sender of the business document.

Element.Name: Reciever party electronic address
Element.Description: BEAst: T0009, Supplier. Peppol: Identifies the receiver party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Document response
Element.Description: Peppol: The document response is used to indicate the result of business document validation. The element 'cac:DocumentResponse/cac:Response/cbc:ResponseCode' MUST contain the overall result code.

Element.Name: Message response code
Element.Description: BEAst: T6407, Order receipt response status. "AP" corresponds to BEAst's "OK" and "RE" to BEAst's "NOK". Peppol: A code signifying the type of response

Element.Name: Response textual notes
Element.Description: BEAst: T6036, Customer remarks. Peppol: Used to make any comments or instructions relevant to the response. The use of this element requires manual assessment by the receiver.

Element.Name: Document reference
Element.Description: Peppol: The document reference is used to provide a reference to the envelope of the business document on which the message level response is based. The message level response message may only cover exactly one business document. The element 'cac:DocumentResponse/cac:DocumentReference/cbc:ID' MUST contain the instance identifier of the envelope of the original business document.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: T6386, Order receipt reference. Peppol: The id of the Despatch- or Receipt advice sent.

Element.Name: Document type code
Element.Description: BEAst: Has no reference to older BEAst standards. Used to inform that this MLR is a Order Receipt Response, "351" should always be used. Peppol: Specifies if it is a reference to a Despatch or a Receipt advice.
